entityId.localType: Public Record Office of Victoria Series Number

nameEntry.part: Roll of Approved Applicants (to foster children)

biogHist.abstract: The Roll of Approved Applicants (to Foster children) was used to facilitate retrieval of information about people who were approved by the Children's Welfare Department to foster children. The information in the Roll includes: applicant's number, name and address, age of wife (and sometimes of husband), occupation of husband or household income per week, sex and ages of children in family, religion, preferred sex and age of child to be fostered and other details such as ward number of child selected, date child or children went to a foster family. The details collected vary over time.
biogHist.p: Conditional Access - Care leavers (and their families) wanting to find information about their time in care, or access personal files can contact Family Information Networks and Discovery, Department of Human Services.

The series in custody appears to be incomplete as it only contains volumes pertaining to Roman Catholic applicants from 1918. It would appear that the Department created Rolls for other religious denominations that have not been transferred to PROV's custody.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Victorian Government Records relating to Wardship and Adoption (1864 - )
